segments.pli: “Gihino vāhaṃ, bhikkhave, pabbajitassa vā micchāpaṭipadaṃ na vaṇṇemi.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I don’t praise wrong practice for laypeople or renunciates.

segments.pli: Gihi vā, bhikkhave, pabbajito vā micchāpaṭipanno micchāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu nārādhako hoti ñāyaṃ dhammaṃ kusalaṃ.
segments.en: Because of wrong practice, neither laypeople nor renunciates succeed in the procedure of the skillful teaching.
It is wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong immersion.
This is called the wrong practice.

segments.pli: Gihino vāhaṃ, bhikkhave, pabbajitassa vā micchāpaṭipadaṃ na vaṇṇemi.
segments.en: I don’t praise wrong practice for lay people or renunciates.

segments.pli: Gihi vā, bhikkhave, pabbajito vā micchāpaṭipanno micchāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu nārādhako hoti ñāyaṃ dhammaṃ kusalaṃ.
segments.en: Because of wrong practice, neither laypeople nor renunciates succeed in the procedure of the skillful teaching.

segments.pli: Gihino vāhaṃ, bhikkhave, pabbajitassa vā sammāpaṭipadaṃ vaṇṇemi.
segments.en: I praise right practice for laypeople and renunciates.

segments.pli: Gihi vā, bhikkhave, pabbajito vā sammāpaṭipanno sammāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu ārādhako hoti ñāyaṃ dhammaṃ kusalaṃ.
segments.en: Because of right practice, both laypeople and renunciates succeed in the procedure of the skillful teaching.
It is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
This is called the right practice.

segments.pli: Gihino vāhaṃ, bhikkhave, pabbajitassa vā sammāpaṭipadaṃ vaṇṇemi.
segments.en: I praise right practice for laypeople and renunciates.

segments.pli: Gihi vā, bhikkhave, pabbajito vā sammāpaṭipanno sammāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu ārādhako hoti ñāyaṃ dhammaṃ kusalan”ti.
segments.en: Because of right practice, both laypeople and renunciates succeed in the procedure of the skillful teaching.”

suttaplex.blurb: Regardless of whether one is a lay person or a renunciate, the Buddha praises the right way, not the wrong way. The wrong eightfold path is the wrong way; the right eightfold path is the right way.
